intro: Aldama hilairei, commonly known as the Hilaire's aldama, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapting to arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
